On Nov 25, 2009, at 2:44pm, Gordon Mohr wrote:

> Bjarne Andersen wrote:
>> Our main challenge is that we need the queues sperated on TLD  
>> (foo.com
>> and bar.com) to use the quota-enforcer to limit number of bytes on  
>> each
>> TLD but at the same time calculate politeness based on the IP- 
>> number so
>> that thousands of TLDs on the same IP-number does not overload the  
>> server.
>> Will this be easier to implement with heritrix 3.x ??
>
> FYI, we've started to use the term 'assignment-level-domain' (or
> 'ALD') for what you're calling 'TLD' here. Of course, a true 'TLD' is
> only the last/'topmost' domain, such as .COM or .DK. And the
> 'second-level-domain' isn't necessarily the level of
> assignment/hostname-sale -- it's sometimes 3rd-level, and occasionally
> even 4th- or more. So 'assignment-level-domain' can be used to
> communicate: whatever level has been registered/sold by a registrar  
> to a
> single entity.

FWIW, the paper on IRLBot used the term PLD (paid-level domain) for  
this concept, and we've adopted that for Bixo.

http://irl.cse.tamu.edu/people/hsin-tsang/papers/www2008.pdf
